description: Borrowed from Latin revoco, revocatus. Doublet of revoke.

verbs.description: revocate (third-person singular simple present revocates, present participle revocating, simple past and past participle revocated)

entries.meaning: To revoke (a person's probation / extended supervision / parole status in the criminal justice context) ex. "My P.O. wants to revocate me" meaning "My probation officer wants to revoke my probation/extended supervision/parole"
